Overview.Summary: President Vladimir Putin was re-elected for a fifth term in the 2024 Russian presidential election (3,6,7,9,10). The election was held on March 17 and Putin won with 87.3% of the vote (3,9). The only candidate who openly contested Putin's hold on power was banned from the race (1,8). Putin announced his intention to run for president again in 2024 (5). This election has been criticized as illegitimate by Western leaders (4,8).

Timeline.Text: Putin announces that he will run for president again in the 2024 Russian presidential election.
An anti-war candidate is banned from running in the 2024 Russian presidential election.
The date for the 2024 Russian presidential election is set for March 17.
The only candidate who openly contested Putin's hold on power is banned from the 2024 Russian presidential election.
Vladimir Putin is declared the winner of the 2024 Russian presidential election.
The international response to Putin's victory in the 2024 Russian presidential election is mixed.
The 2024 Russian presidential election is reported to have broken all records in terms of voter turnout and Putin's percentage of the vote.
Putin is inaugurated as president for his fifth term, with Russia under tight control.

Overview.Summary: In the 2024 Russian presidential election, Vladimir Putin won a landslide victory with 87% of the vote (8). The election was heavily stage-managed and lacked real competition (1,2). Putin's presidency will now extend until at least 2030 (3). Western leaders denounced the election as illegal and many Russians attempted to protest against Putin's repression (6,7). There were concerns of fraud in the election (10) and it is speculated that full mobilization may occur in Russia after the election (9).

Timeline.Text: Russian President Vladimir Putin announces that he will run for another term in the 2024 presidential election.
The presidential election in Russia begins, with Putin expected to secure a fifth term in office.
Putin wins the presidential election with 87% of the vote, extending his rule until 2030.
Western leaders denounce Putin's election win as illegal and undemocratic.
Reports emerge of widespread fraud in the presidential election.
Ukrainian officials suggest that Russia may begin full mobilization after the 2024 presidential election.

Overview.Summary: Vladimir Putin has announced that he will run for president again in the March 2024 election (8). His decision is expected to keep him in power until at least 2024 (6). This move is seen as a sign of how much Russian democracy has regressed under Putin (4). The election is making history on many levels, as it pits a former president, Republican Donald Trump, against the current one, Democrat Joe Biden (2). There are concerns that Russia may begin full mobilisation after the 2024 presidential election (3,7). Putin has also declared his determination to advance deeper into Ukraine and has dangled new threats against the West (9). The outcome of the election was never in doubt, with Putin winning in a landslide victory (9,10).

Timeline.Text: Russian President Vladimir Putin announces his decision to run for the 2024 presidential election.
Ukrainian officials speculate that Russia may begin full mobilisation after the 2024 presidential election.
Early voting for the 2024 Russian presidential election begins in remote regions.
Vladimir Putin is declared the winner of the 2024 Russian presidential election.
The 2024 U.S. presidential election takes place, with Donald Trump and Joe Biden as the main candidates.

Overview.Summary: In the 2024 Russian presidential election, President Vladimir Putin announced his decision to run for another term (2). He has been in power since 1999 and won the election with 87.3% of the vote (3,9). The election was heavily criticized as illegitimate (7). The other candidates had little chance of winning and the election was seen as a way for Putin to extend his rule (4,6,10). The election was held in March 2024 (1,5,8).

Timeline.Text: Russian President Vladimir Putin announces his decision to run in the 2024 presidential election.
Putin uses the election to show that he is still a strong leader, despite war weariness in Russia.
The three-day presidential election begins in Russia, with Putin expected to win another term.
Putin is officially declared the winner of the 2024 presidential election, extending his rule until 2030.
Russia's 2024 election sets new voting standards, with Putin receiving an unprecedented 87.3% of the vote.

Overview.Summary: In the 2024 Russian presidential election, incumbent President Vladimir Putin won with an overwhelming majority of votes (2,5,7,11,19). However, the election has been marred by allegations of fraud and a lack of true competition due to the banning of opposition candidates (3,12,14,17,20). This has led to concerns about the state of democracy in Russia (12,13). The election took place on March 15-17, 2024 (1,4,15,18) and was declared official on March 21, 2024 (2). Putin's decision to run for a fifth term has been seen as a move to extend his rule and maintain his grip on power in Russia (6,8,13,16).

Timeline.Text: Three-day presidential election begins in Russia.
Vladimir Putin votes online in the presidential election at the Novo-Ogaryovo state residence.
President Vladimir Putin is declared the winner of the 2024 Russian presidential election.
Russian President Vladimir Putin announces his intention to run in the 2024 presidential election.
The date of the 2024 Russian presidential election is set for March 17.
Russian democracy regresses as Putin decides that term limits do not apply in the 2024 presidential election.
Putin will use the election to show a war-weary Russia that he is still in control.
Secretary of Ukraine's national security announces that Russia could begin a full mobilization after the 2024 presidential election.
Russian authorities ban the only openly oppositional candidate from the presidential race.
Early voting in the Russian presidential election commences in remote regions.
The license to share, copy, distribute, and transmit the work is granted for the picture of the 2024 Russian presidential election.
